alert.note: Alert for Blaine (Idaho) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued May 09 at 1:02PM MDT until further notice by NWS Pocatello
info.description: ...The Flood Advisory continues for the following rivers in Idaho... Big Wood River at Hailey affecting Blaine County. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/pocatello. ...FLOOD ADVISORY FOR SNOWMELT REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE... * WHAT...Flooding caused by snowmelt continues. * WHERE...Big Wood River at Hailey. * WHEN...Until further notice. * IMPACTS...At 6.0 feet, Moderate flooding will occur along Cedar, War Eagle, and Della Vista Drives in the lower subdivisions in Hailey which may be inaccessible. FLooding in Riverview Drive area of Bellevue. Draper Preserve in Hailey is inaccessible. Water may be over some secondary roads in West Ketchum (Wood River Drive). Gimlet subdivision will have some residents with flooding issues. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 11:45 AM MDT Tuesday the stage was 3.9 feet. - The river remains at bankful, but is holding below minor flood stage. Local emergency management reports localized flooding continues. Some continued snowmelt, runoff, and precipitation is forecast over the next several days, but at this time a significant increase in flooding is not expected. Continue to monitor for updates to this forecast. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage early Monday morning. Additional rises are possible thereafter. - Action stage is 3.7 feet. - Flood stage is 5.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood && Fld Observed Forecasts (12 pm MDT) Location Stg Stg Day/Time Wed Thu Fri Big Wood River Hailey 5.0 3.9 Tue 11 am MD 4.0 4.2 4.4 &&
info.instruction: Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks as flows are high and fast, and the water is dangerously cold. Please report observed flooding to the National Weather Service in Pocatello via phone, email, or social media, when you can do so safely.
